name: The Block
title: Utf8b8jome4jw The Scoop Congressman Tom Emmers
text:
Synopsis
Bitcoin network activity has significantly declined, with transactions dropping 55% from peak levels and protocol-specific activities like Runes showing minimal ongoing engagement, while Congressional support for crypto remains strong.

Key Insights
- Bitcoin network transactions have fallen to a 12-month low of 330,000, down from a peak of 730,000
- Transaction fees have stabilized around $500,000 in the last month
- Runes and Ordinals protocols now account for only 1% of total transactions
- Runes fee generation has dramatically dropped from $60 million on launch day to less than $20,000 in the last 30 days
- Congressman Tom Emmer continues to be a strong crypto advocate in Congress
- Emmer suggests the previous administration's crypto stance may have included intentionally hostile actions
- The current political climate appears more receptive to crypto innovation and potential regulatory clarity
